string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns00000100101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Untitled Scene
Drivers Commands
Main Menu
Landing Page
Drag and Drop
Name the different access levels of the DDU, depending on the ID.
Which colours may the icon on the DDU be and to which severity is each colour related to?
How can the Train driver isolate the mechanical brakes on any single car in the EMU trainset (in single or multiple units) from the cab?
What happens when the driver has released the dead man knob in operation?
Select the correct sequence for how the driver establishes cab-to-cab communication.
How many positions does a windscreen wiper switch have?
Select two types of pressures displayed on the pressure gauge on the drivers desk with the colour of their needles.
Select two types of radios which are found in the driving cab.
Name the different access levels of the DDU, depending on the ID.
What is the purpose of backup state on the EMU trains?
What is the Alarm module used for?
What happens physically when the Emergency pantograph down pushbutton is pressed?
When logged in on the DDU as a driver, which functions are not duplicated by a pushbutton or switch on the drivers desk?
In which driving mode will the selective pantograph operation be available to the driver on the command screen on the DDU?
In which circumstances would the driver be expected to use the selective pantograph operation when operating the train?
The HVAC Demister assists the electric Windscreen Demister to clear the windscreen quickly.
Which is more efficient between the HVAC demister function and electric windscreen demister?
Arrange the following items according to the conditions that must be met to place the train in standby mode.

Select four different zones on the master controller.

If both the Close main circuit breaker pushbutton (22S11) lamp and the Open main circuit breaker pushbutton (22S12) lamp are turned ON, what does it indicate regarding the state of the HSCBs? Mark the correct answer in the box provided.
What can be done with the Traction isolation switch?
Describe the different steps to perform on the DDU before the Main screen appears.
Arrange the following items according to the conditions that must be met to place the train in standby mode.
The Alarm module displays a quick view of the train status by means of icons that can be switched on or switched off by the control system.
Choose 5 icons displayed on the Alarm module.
Where is the Windscreen washer tank filler located?
What happens when the Emergency brake pushbutton is pressed?
What happens when the driver has released the dead man knob in operation?
What does the driver use the Passenger Emergency Intercom communication pushbutton for?
How does the driver know when the parking brake has been applied?
How do you test if the indicator lamps work on the drivers desk?
What happens when activating the Decoupling pushbutton in a Multiple Unit where the units are coupled?
Is the sunshade electrically or manually controlled?
Explain briefly the sequence of operation needed in order to open and close the rear view mirror on the right side.
Explain when the Traction converter isolation switch is used and where it is located.
How can the Train driver isolate the mechanical brakes on any single car in the EMU trainset (in single or multiple units) from the cab?
The PEA reset switch can be activated in both cabs.

What happens when the Emergency brake pushbutton is pressed?

The four push buttons without backlight on the drivers desk typically include:

When do you use the reduced power button?
What is the maximum permissible speed in Depot driving mode?

When does the PEI push button flash and when is constantly lit?

Which pushbuttons must be pressed to feed the EMU trainset with high voltage when the train is in LV ready state? Choose two methods).

Which switch is used by the Train driver to change the EMU Trainset from Cab in service state (Drivers master key in the drivers desk is turned on in one of the cabs) to LV ready state? (110V available).
How many pushbuttons are dedicated to operate the doors on the left side?
What does the master controller equipment comprise of?
